newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Taiwan lowers fuel oil bunker prices by $4/T.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan lowers fuel oil bunker prices by $4/T.

text.p: Taiwan's Chinese Petroleum Corp (CPC) has lowered its bunker fuel prices by $4 per tonne effective February 5, a company statement said on Wednesday.

Posted prices for 180, 280 and 380 centistoke bunker fuel delivered at the ports of Keelung, Hualien, Taichung and Suao were decreased by $4 per tonne, to $123. Term prices were also cut $4 to $120 per tonne.
Spot and term bunker C grade were also lowered by $4 to $121 and $118 respectively.
CPC is Taiwan's monopoly supplier of bunker fuels.
